DOC.brief_summary: Demonstrate response stimulation posterior tibial nerve use Biowave device microneedle patch electrode patient overactive bladder symptom . The investigator hypothesize least 6 weekly treatment modest improvement overactive bladder symptom trend toward improvement .
DOC.brief_title: Utilization BIOWAVE Device Treat Overactive Bladder
DOC.detailed_description: Women 18 year old score equal great 4 OAB-q short form urgency average daily urinary frequency equal great 10 time base 3-day voiding diary plus inclusion criterion review possible enrollment study . Outcomes measured include Global Response Assessment ( GRA ) overall bladder symptom , change 3-day voiding diary parameter adverse event .
DOC.criteria: Women > 18 year age A score > 4 OABq short form urgency ( question 1 ) Average daily urinary frequency > 10 time base 3day void diary Selfreported bladder symptom present > 3 month Selfreported fail conservative care ( i.e. , dietary restriction , fluid restriction , bladder training , behavioral modification , pelvic muscle training , biofeedback , etc . ) Off antimuscarinics least 2 week prior enrollment Capable give informed consent Ambulatory able use toilet independently , without difficulty Capable willing follow studyrelated procedure Pregnant confirm urine pregnancy test , plan become pregnant study period Neurogenic bladder Botox® use bladder pelvic floor muscle past year Pacemakers implantable defibrillator Primary complaint stress urinary incontinence Current urinary tract infection ( UTI ) Current vaginal infection Current use InterStim® Current use Bion® Previously treat Percutaneous Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS ) Use investigational drug/device therapy within past 4 week . Participating participate within past 4 week clinical investigation involve impact gynecologic , urinary renal function . Deemed unsuitable enrollment study investigator base subject ' history physical examination ( include skin disorder treatment site peripheral neuropathy ) . Subjects nerve damage would impact either percutaneous tibial nerve pelvic floor function .
